title: HS40089: Transportation Economics - Quick Facts
text:
HS40089
Course name | Transportation Economics
Offered by | Humanities & Social Sciences
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Spring

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: NoneCourse ContentsSignificance of Transport in Economics; Transport Infrastructure and System; Transport in Economics and Regional Development; Demand for and Supply of Transport; Transport Cost (Internal and External); Optimal Pricing of Transport Services; Investment into the Transport Sector; Cost-Benefit Analysis; Travel Demand and the Value of Travel Time; Improvement of Transport and Joint Land Use; Returns to Scale; Transport Planning and Forecasting; Transport Policy: Regulations, Priorities in Transport Policy; Public versus Private Transport; Transport and Public Welfare.
